info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 26 at 2:48PM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN COLORADO MOUNTAINS... .A cold front moving across the mountains was bringing strong winds and considerable blowing snow along with a quick shot of heavy snow across the northern Colorado mountains this afternoon. There will be near blizzard conditions at times and road closures will be possible. The worst of the snow and winds will be past by this evening, though lighter snow and windy conditions will continue over the higher mountains overnight. Snow will decrease by late afternoon or early evening, but slick roads, lighter snow, and areas of blowing snow will continue through Sunday night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations between 7 and 14 inches, with higher amounts north of Rabbit Ears Pass. Winds gusting between 45 and 65 mph creating near blizzard conditions. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass. * WHEN...The worst conditions will be during the afternoon, with gradual improvement overnight. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult at times. Road closures are possible. Near blizzard conditions can be expected in exposed areas.
info.instruction: Consider avoiding travel over Rabbit Ears Pass, at least until conditions improve later this evening or until tomorrow if possible. If you do travel, drive with extreme caution. Take a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded. For the latest road conditions and closure information, call 5 1 1 or visit www.cotrip.org.
